elements.title: Ivanka Trump (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in 2017 Ivanka Trump (pictured) became the first Jewish member of a U.S. first family?

elements.title: attempted to kidnap two German-Jewish filmmakers (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in 1933 Nazi sympathisers attempted to kidnap two German-Jewish filmmakers in Liechtenstein?

elements.title: Fredy Clue (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Fredy Clue designed Sweden's first unisex folk costume?

elements.title: prostate cancer (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that 1.2 million people are diagnosed with prostate cancer per year and 350,000 people die from it?

elements.title: lynching Norris Dendy (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that five men were accused of lynching Norris Dendy but none were ever indicted?

elements.title: Enchylium conglomeratum (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that while the lichen species Enchylium conglomeratum is considered secure globally, it has been designated as extinct in the UK and regionally extinct in Switzerland?

elements.title: Jordan Murphy (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Jordan Murphy finished his college career ranked second in Big Ten Conference career rebounds, behind Jerry Lucas?

elements.title: Interstate 65 in Tennessee (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a section of Interstate 65 in Tennessee was the first part of the Interstate Highway System to open in the state?

elements.title: Stanley Casson (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the archaeologist Stanley Casson was almost captured – twice – during World War II?
